lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2 -- Appeals to both President Roosevelt and the House for appropriate recognition of the action of a soldier which, if followed up, might have averted or greatly lessened the Pearl Harbor disaster, were made today by Representative Harness of Indiana.
